content.rendered:
Taledo is a curated recruiting platform connecting the top 10% of candidates with market leading companies in the digital ecosystem. Founded in 2015, we are serving clients ranging from DAX corporations to early-stage startups. On our mission to create the number one platform, our team continues to grow.

The ideal candidate:

  • Experience with React (and related tools such as redux) or comparable Javascript frameworks
  • Fluency with HTML5 and CSS3, knowledgeable about trends and methodologies
  • Excitement about thoroughly building a sustainable architecture
  • Degree in Computer Science and several years of relevant work experience
  • Understanding of Usability concepts and experience with Design tools
  • Strong communication skills, e.g. ability to talk about technical topics and express design decisions
  • Berlin residency or willingness to relocate

Your responsibilities:

You will have direct impact on the product and see your code deployed to production within a few days after joining. The Backend is written in Rails, backed by Postgres and ElasticSearch. It’s communicating via a json API to the Frontend, which is written in React and uses related frameworks such as redux and webpack. You will work directly with and report to the CTO.

Working at Taledo:

At Taledo you will work with a highly motivated team of smart people in a truly international atmosphere. While offering an environment that allows you to stay focused and to work professionally, we keep an open door policy and regularly provide fruits, healthy snacks, tea, coffee and yerba mate. Knowledge sharing and supporting each other is key to our success and offers great opportunities for your professional growth. Office is located in the center of Berlin – easy to get to and close to great cafés and bars.

title.rendered: Senior Backend Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform Europace // Europace AG

content.rendered:
Du bist ein erfahrener Entwickler (w/m) und suchst ein Umfeld das Du signifikant mitgestalten kannst? Wir bieten Dir ein Team in dem fachliche und technische Exzellenz der elementare Teil unserer Werte sind. Durch kontinuierliche Entwicklung unseres Produktes sind wir Marktführer in der elektronischen Baufinanzierung in Deutschland.

Europace ist die Plattform zur Vermittlung von Baufinanzierungen auf dem deutschen Finanzmarkt. Wir sind Teil des ersten deutschen Fintech Unicorns Hypoport und sind alles aber keine Bank. Hierarchien waren gestern, heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung und die Motivation eines jeden einzelnen. Eine unserer Stärken ist, dass wir verschiedene neue Ansätze der Arbeitsorganisation ausprobieren. Wir sind Entdecker der Arbeitswelt von morgen, deshalb legen wir auch viel Wert auf ein professionelles Arbeitsumfeld, denn immerhin ermöglicht die Hypoport-Gruppe ein Kredit-Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd.€ pro Monat.

Wer du bist:

  • Du bist ein Senior Mitglied eines professionellen und hochqualifizierten Teams, welches ständig anstrebt die besten und smartesten Lösungen für unsere Businessanforderungen zu finden.
  • Du arbeitest Hand in Hand mit deinen Kollegen aus Produkt, Kundenservice und Vertrieb.
  • Du hast Lust darauf eine komplexe Domäne mitzugestalten.
  • Du entwirfst, implementierst, testest und wartest neue Features und Finanzproduktintegrationen auf der Europace Plattform.
  • Du verbesserst dich ständig und hilfst deinen Kollegen besser zu werden.
  • Du denkst unternehmerisch und richtest deine Entscheidungen an wirtschaftlichen Erfordernissen aus.

Was du kannst:

  • Weitgehende Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von serverseitigen Backends mit objekt-orientierten Sprachen (wir nutzen Java mit Spring und Groovy – wir glauben aber, dass du dich auch einarbeiten kannst).
  • Erfahrung im Entwickeln von skalierbaren und verteilten Services.
  • Interesse an Finanzprodukten. Wir arbeiten in einer komplexen Domäne und erwarten, dass jeder beim Lösungsdesign mitdenkt. Wie eine Baufinanzierung funktioniert bringen wir dir bei.
  • Erfahrung mit serverseitigen Backend-Technologien wie z.B.: Messaging, HTTP und REST, Webservices, Concurrency, Resilienz und Caching.
  • Klarheit und Offenheit in der Kommunikation.

Wie du arbeiten wirst:

  • Du entwickelst eine verteilte, Message basierte Plattform.
  • Continuous Delivery und eine hohe Testabdeckung hilft dir schnell und autonom zu agieren.
  • Das Entwicklungsteam trägt die DevOps Verantwortung.
  • Der Tech-Stack wird im Team entschieden.

Was wir bieten:

Innerhalb der Hypoport-Gruppe wertschätzen wir Vielfalt, daher bieten wir einen Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen. Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an Perspektiven die jeder einbringt. Zusammen bauen wir die führenden digitalen Plattformen für Finanzprodukte. Einige der Vorteile, die wir dir bieten:

  • Innovative Arbeitskultur und eine Umgebung in der du Dinge gestalten kannst wie in einem Startup allerdings mit dem Rückhalt eines etablierten Unternehmens.
  • Sehr gute Work-Life Balance mit flexiblen und familienfreundlichen Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office, 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr sowie die Option dir 10 weitere Urlaubstage zu erkaufen.
  • 130 IT-Kollegen und Kolleginnen, die dich unterstützen und eine aktive Wissenscommunity gestalten.
  • Unsere Prinzipien nach denen wir arbeiten:
    • Wir führen gemeinsam.
    • Wir lernen und entwickeln uns bewusst weiter.
    • Wir arbeiten gemeinsam miteinander.
    • Wir organisieren uns dezentral und autonom.

Wenn du neugierig geworden bist, dann findest du mehr über unsere Kultur auf unserem PnO-Blog https://blog-pno.hypoport.de/. Wenn du mehr über unsere technischen Themen wissen willst, dann besuche doch unseren Europace-TechBlog http://tech.europace.de/.

Möchtest du mehr erfahren? Dann schick uns doch deine Bewerbung, gerne auch mit deinem GitHub-Account.

Bei Fragen wende dich an:

Nadine Lennartz, People & Organisation Partner

Tel. +49 30 420 86 -1925

Europace AG

Klosterstrasse 71, 10179 Berlin

YOU’LL NEED TO HAVE

  • 6+ years as a Full Stack Developer, working with Ruby and JavaScript, and at least one years of experience leading Engineering teams
  • Experience working with true Agile teams and fast-paced environments
  • Strong communication and relationship building skills and a problem-solving attitude.

content.rendered:
As a Data Engineer – Data Product you will be working in a small and multi-disciplinary team solving unique relevance challenges. You will have significant ownership and responsibility in using data and machine learning to impact our customers and business.

About GetYourGuide:

With 400 employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

Team Mission:

The Data team’s mission is to transform our vast amount of data into intelligent products and the best data-driven decisions. We work on a variety of problems as members of cross-functional mission teams. We focus on problems such as search relevance, personalization or marketing automation using cutting-edge algorithms and data infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and maintain data products (e.g. recommendations) both from an architecture and relevance views
  • Design and implement rich data pipelines on Spark to feed the product and machine-learning algorithms with relevant data
  • Work in collaboration with data scientists, back-end engineers, front-end engineers and product managers to deliver updates in the product experience
  • Optimize and improve existing features or data processes for performance and stability

Requirements:

  • Track record in developing production data workflows using Apache Spark
  • Experience applying relevance and machine learning approaches to problems such as recommendations, content relevance or personalization
  • Proficient in Scala and possess strong CS fundamentals
  • Be able to write efficient, well-tested code with an keen eye on scalability and maintainability
  • An analytical mind and bake your decisions with data

Nice to have:

  • Experience working along with data scientists on machine learning data pipelines
  • Experience with product engineering in PHP
  • Experience with data analysis concepts and tools (SQL, Pandas, R)

We Offer:

  • Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • Smart, engaged co-workers
  • Speak English in the office with people from over 50 nationalities
  • Virtual stock options – be part of our success story
  • Quarterly Hackathons and weekly tech talks
  • Annual external training budget – be constantly learning
  • Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation Assistance

Curious?

Do you have the skills for the job, enthusiasm about our vision and fit our culture? We are looking forward to hearing from you! For any further questions regarding this position contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

In the meantime, you can check our blog to see what happens behind the scenes at inside.getyourguide.com and check out Tech Radar at techradar.getyourguide.com for an insight into the stack we use to turn trips into amazing experiences!

Our Marketplace department is looking for a PHP Backend Engineer who cares and thinks as much about enabling a great end-to-end customer experiences as they do about technology. You will work as part of a cross-functional mission team with top-notch developers, designers, analysts and product managers. If you are interested in contributing to the success of a web platform that is used by millions of travellers around the world then keep on reading!

About GetYourGuide:

With 400 employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

Marketplace Team Mission:

Marketplace owns the core customer desktop and mobile web platforms for GetYourGuide. We aim to deliver an amazing customer journey through great user interfaces in combination with rigorous A/B testing to craft an unbeatable e-commerce site and seamless booking experience for our users.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in a cross-functional mission team with engineers, designers and analysts
  • Help to enable your mission team to iterate fast and learn about our customers by designing, launching and iterating on A/B experiments
  • Continuously improve our code base, systems and processes
  • Design and develop efficient solutions that can continue to scale

  • Highly proficient in backend PHP coding, best practices and libraries
  • Willingness and ability to touch JavaScript, CSS and HTML when needed
  • Experience with the architecture and deployment of complex systems
  • Ability to turn ideas into fast, reliable and maintainable code
  • Good understanding of SQL including complex queries and optimization
  • Positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft
  • Customer-centric prioritization and data drive decision making
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have:

  • Experience with A/B testing, hypothesis building and best practices
  • Prior experience working in the e-commerce space
  • Prior experience in start-up environments

content.rendered:
We are looking for a hands-on Engineering Manager to lead people, guide technical architecture decisions and help push the boundaries by developing the next generation of our in-house systems in the realm of Performance Marketing. You will assume line management for 6 engineers working in 3 cross-functional missions teams with other top-notch developers, analysts, data scientists and product managers. This is your chance to write code, develop people and build systems that have a direct impact on the business!

About GetYourGuide:

With 400 employees from 50 nationalities, GetYourGuide is on a mission to turn trips into amazing experiences, using our product and technology to change the way travelers find and book things to do and explore their destination. We connect these travelers to our vast catalog of amazing experiences through our online marketplace.

Marketing Technology Team Mission:

This group is part of the Performance Marketing department and responsible for the development, maintenance and technical vision of the core systems. We aim to be at the cutting edge of advertising technologies and partner with business stakeholders to develop the most impactful features to connect customers with the most relevant tours and activities in our inventory. We have touch points across the business and aim to solve problems at scale with systems that manage 10s of millions of ads.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead architecture discussions and develop next generation systems
  • Lead and grow your direct reports helping them to achieve their potential
  • Partner with our business and technical teams to deliver innovative solutions
  • Review ongoing SEM efforts, identify opportunities and explore new areas
  • Be part of the engineering leadership team shaping the culture at the company
  • Be involved in hiring not only for your team but also others in the company
  • Occasional business travel between Berlin and Zurich

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 2+ years of direct people management in technical teams
  • Minimum of 5+ years of software development experience
  • Highly proficient in backend Python coding, best practices and libraries
  • Passionate about business results & people not just technical excellence
  • Solid understanding of SQL including complex queries and optimization
  • Experience with the architecture and deployment of complex systems
  • Ability to turn ideas into fast, reliable and maintainable code
  • Customer-centric prioritization and data drive decision making
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have:

  • Experience with large scale data processing using Apache Spark
  • Experience with data topics (analytics, monitoring, ETL, pipelines, etc.)
  • Developed against advertising APIs (Google Adwords, Facebook, etc.)
  • Prior experience with paid advertising channels
  • Prior experience in start-up environments

We Offer:

  • Work on a product that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • Smart, engaged co-workers
  • Speak English in the office with people from over 50 nationalities
  • Virtual stock options – be part of our success story
  • Quarterly Hackathons and weekly tech talks
  • Annual external training budget – be constantly learning
  • Well stocked kitchen and our famous pizza & beer Friday’s
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation Assistance

content.rendered:
We work in a multidisciplinary product team and we build elegant user interfaces using an exciting tech stack of React Native for our iOS app and future Android app. We use modern JavaScript across our stack, from our node.js API to our React Native view layer and React-based internal tools.

What is Taxfix?

Taxfix is a well-funded tech startup in the heart of Berlin. It is our mission to make tax declarations easy!

We believe that everybody, regardless of their income, deserves to get the maximum out of their tax returns. Taxfix allows everyone to file taxes in 27 minutes on the mobile phone, without any knowledge about taxes, no stress, and no forms. Taxfix offers a chat-like interface to guide you through the process and gives you the maximum return. You can download Taxfix app on your iPhone. We would love to hear your feedback! (hallo@taxfix.de)

The team

Our team has a proven record in creating products that help people improve their lives. We share a passion for product development and a great user experience. We are a nice, small and international team, with a hard-working attitude, non-bureaucratic processes, and open communication.

We work in a multidisciplinary product team and we build elegant user interfaces using an exciting tech stack of React Native for our iOS app and future Android app. We use modern JavaScript across our stack, from our node.js API to our React Native view layer and React-based internal tools.

The role

We are looking for an experienced React Native Developer to join the team and take Taxfix to the next level.

You will collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team to define and ship the look, feel and interaction across our apps.

You will implement custom UI components for our conversational interface across the product and on multiple platforms.

You are the right fit for the team if:

  • You share our passion for product development and user experience.
  • You can develop outstanding front-end applications using React Native or React.
  • You’re confident with modern JavaScript and tooling.
  • You can make the product visually appealing, easy and enjoyable to use.
  • You work with Git, GitHub, and TDD.
  • You are able to work independently and own a project, but you also love teamwork!
  • You are pragmatic and work autonomously with a strong positive attitude and overcome challenges with passion.
  • You hold a permit to work in Germany.

What do we offer?

  • The opportunity to redefine the way people handle their taxes
  • The opportunity to shape a new and innovative product from scratch
  • The opportunity to have a real impact on company success
  • A great team you will have fun working with
  • A competitive salary and stock options
  • Flexible working hours and a great office location
  • Mac / Apple hardware
  • Tuesday’s company brunch and free meal for late work hours
  • Regular company events

If you feel excited about the idea of being part of Taxfix, then we want to hear from you!

Apply here or reach out to us at jobs@taxfix.de, the contact person is Ana Valentim.

title.rendered: CTO – Chief Technology Officer // MIAMED GmbH

content.rendered:
Ambitious missions – like revolutionizing medical education – require key people to make them happen. That’s why it’s about time for a CTO at Miamed. With your tech and leadership expertise, you will establish our company’s technical vision and lead all aspects of our technology development. You will also help us tackle our big tech challenges: building cross-functional teams and a smooth agile development process, deciding about the technological future of a monolithic platform with multiple target audiences and increasing Miamed’s attractiveness for tech talent.

YOUR JOB

  • Lead the technical strategy for our platform AMBOSS to ensure alignment with its business goals
  • Discover and implement new technologies that yield competitive advantage
  • Work closely with Product, Marketing, Business Development and Operations to define and improve our product for different audiences
  • Build, develop and retain high-performance engineering & IT teams
  • Implement an agile software development process with your Engineering teams
  • Foster a culture of constant improvement in your teams and beyond
  • Develop, track and control budgets for tech purchasing, staffing and operations
  • Manage and optimize infrastructure assets to satisfy financial targets
  • Identify, compare, select and implement technology solutions to meet current and future needs and use stakeholders’ feedback to inform necessary improvements and adjustments to technology
  • Oversee the Office IT infrastructure and company-wide software for employees
  • Identify public speaking opportunities and act as a Miamed tech ambassador to attract tech talent

YOUR PROFILE

  • 10+ years relevant professional experience
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field; MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, both oral and written and with tech and non-tech audiences
  • Proficient German and English language skills
  • Strong interpersonal, leadership and organizational abilities
  • Experience with building high performance teams and implementing agile methodologies
  • Interest in public speaking
  • Successful in fast paced and quickly changing environments
  • Technical expertise in web systems architecture, design and development
  • Knowledge of technological trends to build strategy
  • Understanding of budgets and business-planning
  • Ability to conduct technological analyses and research
  • Strategic thinking
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • A passion for medicine and/or e-learning is a big plus
  • Kind, warm-hearted personality

WHAT WE OFFER

  • An opportunity to play a key role in creating a product that has the potential to improve medical care for billions of people
  • Diverse and interesting tasks with a high degree of autonomy
  • Ambitious and dynamic team with a flat hierarchy
  • Lively start-up with a trusting and friendly atmosphere
  • Flexible hours
  • Offices in Cologne and Berlin
  • Regular team building events
  • A company yoga studio in Berlin and free yoga classes at least 2 times per week
  • Free membership at the Urban Sports Club, with multiple locations throughout Germany
  • An Italian espresso machine, the best Argentinian steak in the city straight off the grill, a terrace with panoramic views of the city, and a fully stocked fridge
  • A fun-filled working environment (how often do you get that)?

title.rendered: Senior Mobile Engineer (iOS) – Continuous Delivery (m/f) // Enfore AG

content.rendered:
We are enfore AG.

Enfore AG was founded in 2009 as NumberFour AG by Marco Boerries to re-imagine how small businesses utilize technology. We have built an open business platform to develop solutions that help 200+ million small businesses stay competitive in a connected world. Our bold vision is simple: every small business should enjoy similar efficiencies and scalability that are typically only available to large enterprises.

Our headquarters is located in Berlin, Germany, with an additional office in Hamburg, Germany.

As a Senior Mobile Engineer (iOS) – Continuous Delivery (m/f) at enfore you will join an experienced and international Continuous Delivery team, who values and practices transparency, supportive feedback and direct communication.

Your role:

  • Work in an environment that prefers quality over quantity and soundness over deadlines
  • Take full responsibility of features across all levels
  • Deliver high-quality solutions that meet business objectives in a flexible, collaborative, and rapidly changing environment
  • Ensure to always keeping the big picture and our customers in mind
  • Build, improve, speed up and simplify pipelines for continuous delivery
  • Help developers in automating every single aspect from code to running applications.
  • Ensure platform and UX consistency by establishing and automating modern test patterns.
  • Introduce modern metrics-based deployment processes
  • Develop sustainable solutions by applying a clean Infrastructure as Code approach.
  • Develop scripts for automation of every aspect of development, build and deployment processes
  • Manage a backlog of tasks centered on continuous improvement of the system

Requirements

  • 4+ years of professional experience with Objective-C and/or Swift
  • Knowledge around continuous and automated deployments of mobile solutions
  • Profound knowledge of Xcode and Instruments
  • Problem-solving attitude across all levels
  • Experience with test-driven development and professional development processes
  • Enthusiastic about working in multidisciplinary teams
  • Solid English communication skills
  • Experience managing App Store releases
  • Working on-site in one of our beautiful offices in Berlin or Hamburg
  • M.Sc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

Extra Qualifiers we’d like to see

  • Experience with Objective-C to Swift migration
  • Knowledge in virtualization and containerization
  • Open minded regarding other platforms despite the focus on iOS
  • Active member of mobile development community (meetup, GitHub, stack overflow, etc.)

Questions? We are happy to hear from you!

jobs@enfore.com

title.rendered: Working Student (m/f) Frontend Development // SuitePad GmbH

content.rendered:
We shape the hotel room of the future!

As the European market leader for in-room-tablets, more than 400 of the most renowned hotels worldwide trust us with their digital guest communication. For our international and agile team of three Full Stack Developers, two Android Developers and a Head of Engineering, we are on the hunt for a frontend focused working student (m/f). You love coding and are on the lookout to expand your knowledge in frontend development? Then we are thrilled to get to know you!

About what to expect:

Our Engineering Team develops the software and support infrastructure to remotely administer 10,000s of android devices. The devices are used daily by hotel guests and staff, so they have to run reliably. We’re looking for a team member who can support our Engineering Team to the fullest extent of his or her technical abilities, and do his or her best to grow those capabilities. The core assignments we’ll send your way (as a best guest):

Special Projects (5-10 hours) – We’d like to let you utilize what you already know and help that knowledge expand. Special projects could include:

  • If you have the skills, write tests to help expand our automated testing coverage
  • Helping write a Github<>Youtrack API integration
  • If we’re able to move far enough, we might be able to ask you to work on production code – with close mentorship

Occasional Manual QA (5 hours per week)

  • Assistance diagnosing technical issues with our tablets – sorting out configuration problems vs bugs
  • Manual testing of new features for Android with predefined test cases (the hours invested in this will continue to decline as we automate more of our testing, so you can focus on special projects more!)

Random technical tasks (<5 hours per week) - depends on your ability, but might include:

  • Setting up specialized raspberry pis, oDroids or other devices
  • Potentially helping with setups around our new IOT development projects
  • Random WIFI setup/troubleshooting
  • Helping SSH into remote tablets to diagnose technical issues from clearly defined instructions

A great deal of your success will depend on your passion and openness to learn and grow.

About your profile:

  • You are currently enrolled in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field
  • You have growing knowledge in Front-End technologies like CSS3, HTML5 and Javascript. It would be amazing if you had experience with Ember.js and/or any experience writing automated tests in QUnit
  • You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and are able to prioritize and work independently
  • You can think outside the box and have a proactive working style
  • You have excellent command of English, German skills are a plus but not required
  • You are available to work between 15 and 20 hours per week and are interested in joining our team for at least six months
  • You are eager to grow, can take constructive feedback well, and see yourself in a web focused professional role

About our offer:

  • An innovative product with global traction and a lot of, no literally, tons of Android tablets and other devices at your disposal
  • You become part of our excellent Engineering Team and get exciting insights into our development cycle
  • You are right in the thick of things instead of watching from the sidelines and you will experience our successful development close up
  • A modern office right in the heart of Berlin and an environment where your ideas and impact are cherished
  • A competitive salary and the prospect of a long term collaboration
  • Yes, we have free drinks, fresh fruits and regular team events but more importantly: we are an international team that is fun to work with :-)

Who we are:

As a young Berlin start-up, we are re-defining the way hotels connect with guests. In the hotel room of the future, you’ll find guest directory, telephone, TV remote, climate controls, newspapers and even order room service on a single device – the SuitePad.

Technical Overview:

Our tech team has built a robust service oriented architecture that powers over 20,000 devices – tablets, large format digital touch screens, signage and even a touch projector, courtesy of a special partnership with Sony’s Xperia Touch Team. We power our devices with Android, digging deep into Android OS with our own custom ROMs. We’re primarily a Android/Ruby/Ember shop with some services and node.js and moving some services towards Elixir. We’re running our infrastructure on AWS, currently in dockerized EC2 instances with a home rolled orchestration system, but migrating to ECS. Most of our services are back by PostgreSQL DBs, with some redis and NoSQL sprinkled in where it makes sense. Finally, we use AMQP for as a message bus to tie server communications together.

Want to join us? Go ahead and apply!

Get in touch – become part of our team and shape our success story! Please send us:

  • Your CV
  • Cover letter (optional)
  • Any reference project(s) you have been part of.
  • Please mention any relevant special skills you have or want to improve.
  • We’d also love to see a link to your GitHub profile – please direct us to any highlights we should look at.

Please send the above to Elisa Mucheyer (HR) at jobs@suitepad.de. We are looking forward to getting to know you.

content.rendered:
We believe in bringing happiness to people through interior designs that turn their homes and offices into places they love.

In our pursuit to innovate living, we deliver exceptional & affordable interior design solutions. Whether our clients are looking for design inspiration or want us to bring the ideas to life ourselves, we strive to make their experience as convenient & inspirational as humanly possible – and, by the way, that’s only where we start!

We pride ourselves in the service we deliver. And, we value the people that turn our mission into a reality. Our dream is to create a work environment that connects great talent, gives them the freedom to do great stuff and continuously supports opportunities for learning and growth. At 99chairs, colleagues turn into friends and goals are accomplished as a team.

Are you looking for the next step in your career?

Then join our team of talented entrepreneurs right in the heart of the startup capital Berlin!

The role

  • You are responsible for the development and the success of our platform
  • Together with your colleagues you design, prioritise and organise new features and requirements from idea to publication
  • You work closely with our IT department to ensure short development cycles
  • You continuously improve and optimise the workflow as well as the internal and external communication
  • You coordinate your own projects and represent them in a transparent and understandable way
  • You are responsible for the requirements-engineering, the determination, definition and analysis of use cases as well as the buildup and fostering of the product backlog
  • You support and take over projects to develop our API and following frontend solutions
  • You analyse functional and technical problems and then come up with creative solutions

Your skills & experience

  • You have a degree in a related field (ideally with a focus on IT), with above average grades
  • You have experience with Scrum, Kanban & Co as well as with project management tools like Jira. Furthermore, you have experience with the definition of web applications like user stories, mockups and test cases
  • You have great communication and teamwork skills
  • You have technical understanding
  • You speak fluent English. German skills are a plus
  • You are a well-structured thinker and result-oriented worker with outstanding analytical skills as well as a hands-on mentality
  • You burn for technology and are familiar with current trends in IT

More reasons to work at 99chairs

  • A flat work environment with innovative decision making processes. We don’t just say this, but do our very best to make sure that everyone’s voice is being heard.
  • Flexible work hours and environment. As long as you get things done and are aligned with your team, you have complete autonomy over your work-life.
  • A kitchen fully stocked with healthy snacks & drinks as well as weekly team lunches.
  • A BVG ticket to brighten up your commute
  • The possibility to furnish your home with our amazing discount rates.

Are you the right fit?

We are looking for people that are smart entrepreneurs at heart, who love responsibility and bring projects and ideas forward – every single day. We love constant learners, team players, and people who agree that strong teams are built based on honesty!

Interested? Then submit your application including cover letter, CV, grades and references by clicking on the button below. We can’t wait to get to know you!

*99chairs is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

content.rendered:
As the Head of Data Engineering (m/f), through our greenfield data warehousing initiative, you are key to building our data team and unlocking our data potential!

Valendo is a dynamic, fast-growing FinTech startup in the lending sector. We offer our customers an innovative financing solution as an alternative to traditional equity and debt strategies with a focus on working capital solutions. We currently serve a wide range of small and medium sized businesses, with a strong focus on fast-growing e-commerce and trading companies. Valendo was founded in 2015 by FinLeap, the leading FinTech Company Builder in Europe. Join us as Head of Data Engineering (m/f) for our office in Berlin.

Your Role & Responsibilities:

  • Build a tailor made data warehouse solution from scratch to support Valendo’s growing business processes
  • Develop and optimise Valendo’s data model for purpose and simplicity with an eye on performance and scalability
  • Integrate Valendo’s wide range of customers through financial and logistics API’s
  • Enable meaningful and insightful reports for data analysis and risk monitoring
  • Ensure systematic quality assurance for the validation of accurate data processing
  • Develop, lead and mentor our future team of data engineers

Our perfect match:

  • You have strong knowledge of Python, SQL (PostgreSQL), Linux and ideally Jenkins
  • You have exposure to AWS or GoogleCloud
  • You are fascinated by data and driven to produce purposeful data models
  • You ideally have experience establishing and maintaining data warehouses
  • You enjoy leading and mentoring small teams, with a keen eye for hiring

About Us:

  • We are innovating traditional lending processes, supporting a wide range of clients to grow their businesses
  • Talented, dedicated and passionate people are at the core of our business bringing together finance and tech skills
  • We are a fast growing team, empowering each team member to take full ownership of their activities
  • We believe hard work and success deserve to be celebrated—both in and out of the office

Apply online with your one-page CV or LinkedIn profile.

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Best, Tom from the Recruiting Team

content.rendered:
We’re here to solve a problem faced by all mobile app marketers: how to find the best possible users for their apps at the best possible price. By connecting mobile app marketers with over a billion users worldwide through our performance-focused technology, we enable them to acquire just the ones that will help them to achieve their business goals.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Develop reusable HTML5 game templates that can be configured and re-skinned to accommodate a variety of needs for AppLift Studio
  • Take ownership over fixing problematic creative issues as they are identified in live campaigns
  • Communicate technical discoveries to project managers and other developers on team
  • Evaluate and implement experimental JavaScript libraries and frameworks as needed
  • Document and guide our creative best-practices to help avoid common development pitfalls/mistakes
  • Innovate new tools to automate laborious testing procedures and improve accuracy of results

Our Requirements:

  • 2-3 years experience working in a game studio or in a similar environment
  • General knowledge of games / game types and interest in game development
  • Interest in UX-oriented development approach, good knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite
  • Comfortable using Chrome developer tools and evaluating JS performance/rendering speed
  • Interested in making sense of analytical data to predict trends and detect problems
  • Comfortable modifying/writing reusable component libraries to help facilitate creative development processes
  • Knowledge of common JS development patterns/methodologies, bundling/minification techniques, and Node.js preprocessing
  • Understanding of JavaScript load/execution order, AJAX request handling, and parsing/manipulating DOM elements using vanilla JS
  • Experience with JavaScript unit-testing, Game Engines like PixiJS and MRAID API, or optimizing rendering performance is a huge plus

What We Offer:

  • Join one of the top mobile advertising companies worldwide
  • Benefit from working with some of the most experienced professionals of our industry and constantly grow with us
  • Enjoy startup perks (our lounge area, gaming in the office, team events, boat parties and many more) in a stable and profitable company
  • Be a part of a multinational team (35+ nationalities) that will bring mobile advertising to the next level
  • Take responsibility from the first day and manage projects that will have a significant impact on AppLift’s success
  • Enjoy a competitive salary package and benefit from a tailored career development path

Interested? Please submit your CV and other relevant documents online.

content.rendered:
Playable Ad’s Project Manager (m/f) for AppLift

What We Do:
We’re here to solve a problem faced by all mobile app marketers: how to find the best possible users for their apps at the best possible price. By connecting mobile app marketers with over a billion users worldwide through our performance-focused technology, we enable them to acquire just the ones that will help them to achieve their business goals.

Your Responsibilities:

  • End-to-end coordination of the AppLift Studio process from demand management, initial specification to delivery of interactive content and knowledge mgmt
  • Management and development of interdisciplinary team of artists, designers and developers (both internal and external)
  • Be the central link between creative production and sales/account management
  • Help setting priorities and allocate creative production resources to achieve maximal outcome for the business
  • Drive further development of AppLift Studio to contribute more value to the performance marketing business with focus on RTB
  • Help troubleshooting and testing of the interactive content, leveraging data analytics to understand the effectiveness of ads developed
  • Support strategic development of AppLift Studio to ensure that our main goals are met in terms of increasing the performances of our campaigns

Our Requirements:

  • 2-3 years of experience with project management in a creative/technical environment, e.g. Game Studio preferred, Mobile Agency
  • Experience with end-to-end production of interactive content, e.g. mini-games, mobile apps, preferably on Playable/Rich-media ads on programmatic channels
  • Good understanding of HTML5/web technologies, experience with managing development of JavaScript applications preferred
  • Good general understanding of gaming and advertising industries, exposure to real-time-bidding (RTB) mobile app performance campaigns preferred
  • Strong communication skills: ability to communicate effectively across a broad range of technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Ability to negotiate and influence within a multifunctional organization to achieve goals.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Result-driven and proactive personality, experience working in a startup environment preferred

What We Offer:

  • Join one of the top mobile advertising companies worldwide
  • Benefit from working with some of the most experienced professionals of our industry and constantly grow with us
  • Enjoy startup perks (our lounge area, gaming in the office, team events, boat parties and many more) in a stable and profitable company
  • Be a part of a multinational team (35+ nationalities) that will bring mobile advertising to the next level
  • Take responsibility from the first day and manage projects that will have a significant impact on AppLift’s success
  • Enjoy a competitive salary package and benefit from a tailored career development path

Interested? Please submit your CV and other relevant documents online.

content.rendered:
We are looking for a talented Team Lead Internal IT (m/f) to innovate, develop, and operate the next generation of Outfittery’s internal IT Infrastructure. Exceptional engineers with expertise in Microsoft server administration, server orchestration, monitoring, security, storage and open source technologies are being sought.

You will join and lead a team of talented, passionate engineers engaged in building mission critical business and engineering infrastructure. Your main stakeholders will be the Chief Technical Officer and the Chief Operations Officer.

The work environment is flexible, high-paced, and highly dynamic. Innovative approaches in architecture, technology, infrastructure, problem solving and operations will be required.

This position is a full-time position based in the heart of Berlin, requires no travel, and is simply the most fun you will ever have.

OUTFITTERY is Europe’s largest Personal Shopping Service for men. We know that shopping isn’t a pleasure for every man, but we’re here to change that! This is why we set a clear goal: a world where men have time for the important things in life and are still well-dressed.

Your responsibilities:

  • Leading a team of 3 administrators
  • Shaping of the company’s internal IT direction
  • Planning yearly IT budget and purchasing necessary equipment and software and negotiating contracts with third parties
  • Systems and servers administration (Microsoft focus), upgrading, and scaling
  • Setting standards for the use of software/hardware/networks company wide
  • Coordinating and consulting strategic decisions with managers of various departments
  • Software patches and updates over automated deployment (PDQ Deploy/MDT)
  • Network LAN & WAN support and administration
  • You implement VPNs, mailing systems, FTP, Backup and storage
  • Managing and administering of our call center infrastructure
  • Expand and monitor existing Zabbix infrastructure for our warning systems
  • Maintain and expand an internal network and security for 500+ devices
  • You are the final escalation point for issues related to IT internal systems and you manage, mentor, support, and further develop employees

Your profile:

  • You have more than 3 years of system administration experience in a Windows environment (Linux experience is a plus), including:
  • Designing and maintaining build systems and test lab infrastructure
  • Administration of systems running Windows, Linux and Xen, VMWare
  • Perfect knowledge of Microsoft AD, ideally MCSA certified
  • Knowledge implementing monitoring systems, including Zabbix and Nagios
  • Experience with Jira / Atlassian tools is a plus
  • Good scripting skills in at least one of the following languages: powershell, batch, bash, perl, python
  • Your are a great project manager, but you also enjoy hands-on work
  • You have profound knowledge of cloud PBX, management of SIP clients and general call center infrastructure
  • You have good team leadership, people management, and communication skills
  • You have sharp and persistent troubleshooting skills: you can fix anything
  • You are passionate about operating systems internals, security, performance tuning, distributed systems, embedded systems and computer networks
  • You are result oriented and can work independently in a deadline driven environment
  • You can be successful working with development teams in multiple locations
  • You speak English fluently, knowledge in German is a plus

​We offer:

  • An international, intelligent team which is eager to revolutionize shopping for men
  • A transparent company culture with highly motivated colleagues, who work on our ambitious goals
  • An exciting and responsible role, with great impact
  • An honest and open feedback culture and individual development opportunities

Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Indra Jonuscheit.

content.rendered:
You want to work in an international IT team that’s working on changing the world of on-demand services? Let your heart beat for building hybrid mobile platforms and progressive web applications – join Zipjet and let’s wash some dirty laundry together!

Who we are

Zipjet is Europe’s leading on-demand laundry & dry cleaning service, operating in London, Paris and Berlin. We take the hassle of laundry off our customers’ hands, so they can spend more time doing the things they enjoy. To do this, we’ve created a cutting-edge, app-based service that allows our customers to have their laundry collected and delivered back to them in as little as 24 hours. Think of us as a remote control for your laundry pile!

Our service is available on mobile apps (iOS & Android) and via our website. We strive for operational excellence and build solutions to serve large numbers of customer in a highly reliable and autonomous manner.

We’re a young team of about 50 people across our three cities, with a great mix of previous professional experience. Our backgrounds are diverse, both culturally and professionally. One thing we all have in common, though, is that we are passionate about making Zipjet a success.

About our IT team:

Currently we are focusing on door-to-door laundry services. In order to provide excellence towards our customers we need assistance

  • in building mobile and web-apps for a convenient customer experiences
  • in building internal tools and apps for the operational / logistics part

We are mainly focusing on a homogeneous ecosystem around progressive web apps and hybrid mobile apps.

About the role:

As a Zipjet’ Mobile Javascript Developer (m/f) you will be in charge of developing new internal and customer facing apps and improve existing apps.

You will work closely with our product manager, operations manager, marketing and design. So you have to chance to shape things as we go. We integrate our developers into the whole development cycle. From the first ideas, over prototypes and the final release.

That being said, the skill-set for a developer here at Zipjet would be:

What we are looking for:

  • 3+ years experience in Javascript development with frameworks like React.js or Angular.js
  • Advanced knowledge of implementing REST-Api clients
  • Advanced knowledge of HTML5 / CSS
  • Basic to advance knowledge of concepts like Redux.js
  • Basic knowledge in writing Unit-Tests and Behavioral-Test (ideally test driven design)
  • Basic knowledge of the differences between React.js and React.Native
  • Basic knowledge of the differences in the UI/UX philosophies of Android vs. iOS
  • Code versioning with git

It’s a plus if you have:

  • Strong experience in React.Native and Redux
  • Some backend experience in Node.js, PHP or Java (SpringBoot)
  • A personal GitHub account with hobby projects where we can have a look at
  • Contributed to open-source projects

Who you are:

As a professional in your field, you like to get your hands dirty making things work, setting your own goals, and doing your best to achieve them. You are self-motivated, like to satisfy your natural curiosity, and have the urge to complete your work the most efficient and correct way. When an idea comes to your head, you are enthusiastic to share the idea and put it into practice. You are not afraid to play around and build everything based on your vision. Finally, you really like what you are doing, and you’re able to enjoy the results of great team-work and an excellent product.

What we offer:

A setting that allows you to shape the essential parts of a business operation. Cutting edge technology allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutions. The prospect of making people’s lives a bit easier. A goal-oriented working atmosphere, in an international environment, with a flat hierarchy and an open-door policy. And yes, we are also offer free laundry, drinks, cereal, and regular team events, but we know that’s not the main reason you want to join us!

Are you up for a challenge?

We are looking forward to receive your complete application including your earliest starting date, your personal GitHub account with some code samples and a list of projects you worked on with pride.

content.rendered:
Do you want to take part in the next technological revolution?

We are relayr, an IoT company specialising in the Digital Transformation of Industries. We provide powerful, simple-to-use tools which enable fast and cost effective development of new solutions, equipment and services for the fascinating, constantly evolving world of Internet of Things.

relayr has been described as one of the most successful startups in the industry and we are looking for a IT Administrator (m/f) to join our team in Berlin and help us bring things to life!

We are looking for someone to provide first / second line IT support and IT Administration within a busy environment. The role will also involve providing assistance with support and development of internal projects as required.

Your tasks:

  • Provide effective and friendly 1st / 2nd line support to all users over the business core operating hours.
  • Resolve support issues on Mac and Windows devices, including desktop applications. Basic phone and network system management.
  • Complete daily proactive checks of the IT infrastructure systems.
  • Maintain existing, and deploy new desktop systems as required.
  • Assist with the proactive management of the IT infrastructure including the monitoring of server systems.
  • Perform basic administration for our team collaboration tools from Atlassian
  • Identify possible issues and escalate if necessary.
  • Escalate recurring and major incidents to relevant senior support staff.
  • Follow department procedures and processes for key administration tasks as required.
  • Update internal infrastructure and inventory documentation.
  • Administer cloud-based accounts

Your skills:

  • 2 years IT support experience
  • Working within a busy IT service desk environment
  • A good understanding of Windows, Mac and Linux operating systems, client-server networks and Microsoft Office applications is required
  • Network infrastructure experience (Cisco) with Switches, Routers, Wireless, Servers
  • Basic understanding of virtualisation (Virtualisation concepts, VMware Vsphere 5, Server and desktop virtualisation)
  • Telephony & PBX knowledge is a plus (Cisco)
  • Basic knowledge of Atlassian collaboration tools such as Jira, Confluence, Hipchat
  • IT related degree, MCSA, ITIL Foundation is a plus
  • An ability to learn fast within a growing and developing company
  • Good interpersonal skills within a demanding and challenging environment

We Offer:

  • Flexible office environment
  • A diverse and friendly team with people from all over the world, speaking 20+ languages, of all ages and parental-status
  • Connecting you with a network of companies and people from around the globe
  • A learning environment where you can extend and build upon your skills and interests, as well as knowledge-sharing and an expanding library of books
  • Opportunities to attend events and conferences pertaining to your discipline
  • Competitive Salary and Stock Options
  • Cool office located in Kreuzberg with a relaxation room, standing-desks, 3D printer and free fruit and drinks
  • Free German courses at intermediate and advanced level (Working language is English)
  • We offer the ability to work in a cutting-edge field with the best people in the IoT industry!

Sounds interesting? Please follow the link to apply for this position:

https://relayr.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=68

content.rendered:
Taledo is a curated recruiting platform connecting the top 10% of candidates with market leading companies in the digital ecosystem. Founded in 2015, we are serving clients ranging from DAX corporations to early-stage startups. On our mission to create the number one platform, our team continues to grow.

Your profile

  • 3+ years of professional working experience with Ruby (e.g. Rails or Sinatra) and ideally also JavaScript frameworks (e.g. React)
  • You are ready to take the next step in your career and want to continue coding while managing a team
  • Excitement about thoroughly building a sustainable architecture
  • Strong communication skills, e.g. ability to talk about technical topics and express design decisions
  • Degree in Computer Science
  • Berlin residency or willingness to relocate

Your responsibilities

  • You will be responsible for architectural design, code review and sprint delivery
  • You will manage and support a small team of developers
  • You will adjust tools and processes as the team grows
  • You will see your code deployed to production within days after joining
  • You will work directly with and report to the CTO

Your environment

At Taledo you will work with a highly motivated team of smart people in a truly international atmosphere. While offering an environment that allows you to stay focused and to work professionally, we keep an open door policy and regularly provide fruits, healthy snacks, tea, coffee and yerba mate. Knowledge sharing and supporting each other is key to our success and offers great opportunities for your professional growth. The office is located in the center of Berlin – easy to get to and close to great cafés and bars.

title.rendered: System Administrator / IT Support (m/w) // Seven Senders

content.rendered:
YOU SELL. WE DELIVER. Das ist die Devise bei Seven Senders. Mit unseren Produkten und Services revolutionieren wir den globalen Onlinehandel. Wir optimieren alle Prozesse nach dem Checkout und bieten unseren Kunden ein einmaliges Einkaufserlebnis bis zur erfolgreichen Lieferung der Waren. So ermöglichen wir Onlineshops ihre Kunden im Ausland bis zu 30 % günstiger, doppelt so schnell sowie mit innovativen Zusatzleistungen zu beliefern und geben ihnen diverse IT-Tools an die Hand, mit denen sie ihre Kunden glücklich machen können. Wir managen nicht nur im Hintergrund die physische Lieferkette zwischen Shoplager und Kunde, sondern bieten auch ein einheitliches 7S-Tracking-System, welches im Shop-Design nach außen glänzt. E-Commerce war nie so einfach, transparent und günstig.

System Administrator / IT Support (m/w)

Berlin, ab sofort

Deine Aufgaben

Als Systemadministrator (SA) bist Du verantwortlich für die effektive Bereitstellung, Installation / Konfiguration, den Betrieb und die Wartung der Systemhardware und -software und der zugehörigen Infrastruktur. Außerdem stellst du sicher, dass Systemhardware, Betriebssysteme, Softwaresysteme und zugehörige Abläufe reibungslos funktionieren. Des Weiteren gehören folgende Aufgaben zu deiner täglichen Arbeit:

  • Administration von Fachbereichsanwendungen
  • Beschaffung, Installation und Wartung von Hardware(-Kompo­nenten), wie Computersystemen, Druckern und Storagesystemen
  • Einrichten von Arbeitsplätzen
  • Benutzeradministration & Systemadministration
  • Beraten und schulen von Benutzern
  • Interner User Helpdesk und Fehlerbeseitigung
  • Analyse von bestehenden Problemen und deren nachhaltige Lösung
  • Erweiterung und strukturelle Änderungen des internen Netzwerks
  • Installation & Konfiguration neuer / vorhandener Server
  • Recherche und Empfehlung innovativer und möglichst automatisierter Ansätze für Systemadministrationsaufgaben

Unsere Erwartungen an Dich

Du solltest Spaß an der Arbeit haben und Dich in den folgenden Punkten wiederfinde

  • Du hast Informatik, Software-Engineering o. ä. studiert oder anderweitig ein gleichwertiges breites IT-Wissen erworben
  • Du hast eine ausgeprägte Leidenschaft für Betriebssysteme und Serveradministration
  • Du liebst es, SA-bezogene Lösungen zu entwickeln
  • Es macht dir Spaß einem Problem auf den Grund zu gehen, die Ursache zu identifizieren und eine Lösung zu entwickeln
  • Du bist Dienstleistungsorientiert
  • Du kannst Dich selbst organisieren und Verantwortung für Deine Ergebnisse übernehmen
  • Deutsch fließend in Wort und Schrift
  • Gute Englischkenntnisse

Unser Angebot

Als junges Unternehmen sind wir für Dich der ideale Arbeitgeber und bieten:

  • Ein sympathisches, hochprofessionelles und motivierendes Team
  • Verantwortungsvolle, herausfordernde und vielfältige Aufgaben
  • Start-up-Atmosphäre in einem rasant wachsenden Unternehmen
  • Internationale, interdisziplinäre Kolleg(inn)en
  • Ein lockeres Arbeitsumfeld im Herzen Berlins
  • Eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung

Wir haben Dich überzeugt! Dann freuen wir uns auf ein ausführliches Kennenlernen, auf Deine Ideen und Deine Vorstellungen von der Arbeit bei uns.

Dein Ansprechpartner ist Herr Marcel Storost, T.: 0176 237 155 45

title.rendered: App Developer iOS/Android (m/w) // Keleya Digital Health Solution

content.rendered:
In short, what is Keleya: We are an app-based wellbeing coach for pregnant women with focus on exercise and nutrition.
Our overall goal is to increase the wellbeing of pregnant women. Nearly 100% of pregnant women suffer from physical discomforts, which can be relieved via the right nutrition and exercise. But current solutions only offer one-size-fits-all content or are offline (e.g. birth prep classes). With Keleya, we offer individual content such as Yoga- & Pilates workouts and recipes, based on the needs of our users and an integrated algorithm. Our app was launched this week and gets monetized via a subscription model.

Are you all-in to revolutionize pregnancy and actually do a difference in the world? Then become part of the Keleya-Family!

What will you be doing:

  • You are responsible for the Keleya product development, optimization and
  • maintenance
  • Getting shit done on front & backend
  • Developing new features for Keleya
  • Translate our vision into a great product

What you bring to the table:

  • App developing background and actual coding knowledge in Swift, Objective-C and
  • Java
  • Experience working with React Native
  • Experience with agile product management
  • Knowledge in Scrum with JIRA
  • UX/UI Design skills

What we offer in return:

  • An open playing field to bring in your ideas
  • A working product and great business KPIs
  • An amazing team and numerous team events
  • 6th floor office with a view onto Alexanderplatz
  • Good pay and virtual share options
  • Starting from November

content.rendered:
We love photography! You do too?

For our IT Team in our headquarters in Berlin we are looking for an
IT Project Manager (m/f)!

Our international team, already over 450 people worldwide, channels this passion into high quality products, modern technology and traditional craftsmanship to create a special experience. The two brands of Avenso GmbH – LUMAS and WhiteWall – stand for absolute perfection in photography.

Our hand-signed, original photographs have been awing crowds in over 40 LUMAS galleries since 2004. Through affordable editions in relatively large runs, we are democratising the art market.

WhiteWall is our own professional lab for custom-made works, and professional photographers praise its quality. Our premium products meet every desire.

Your responsibilities:

  • You bridge the gap between business and technology and understand the IT systems and technologies that drive our business
  • You identify opportunities for business improvement and think big
  • You prioritize and plan offline and online IT projects and take over communication with all stakeholders
  • You break down all features into clear requirements and tasks
  • You support, supervise and monitor the projects
  • You work closely with the CTO

Your profile:

  • You have successfully completed a degree in information technology and have a good understanding of business processes
  • You have 3-5 years of relevant experience in coordinating and managing IT projects
  • You have worked as a IT Project Manager or in a similar role before, preferably in e-commerce for high-end consumer products
  • You have experience in coding
  • Ability to use SQL for analyzing data & testing as well as experience in working with ERP-systems and SAP
  • You have strong analytical skills, a very structured approach, and a hands-on mentality
  • You are fluent in English and German

What we offer:

  • An innovative and international environment as the continuously expanding market leader for photography and art editions with long-term perspectives
  • Products that inspire passion in our customers, partners and coworkers
  • Ongoing professional development
  • An atmosphere that encourages you to spark change
  • A flat hierarchy and an open working atmosphere
  • Interesting insights into the world of photography and art

How to apply

We look forward to receiving your online application with your earliest starting date and your salary expectations.

Any queries? Please contact Rosalina Stuckert via jobs@avenso.com.

Apply now: https://avenso.jobbase.io/job/2c3vsjo8

www.lumas.com | www.whitewall.com

title.rendered: Senior WEB developer // Pixformance Sports GmbH

content.rendered:
For three years Pixformance has been creating gym equipment that changes the way people think about modern fitness and gyms. As a company and a brand we are entering a new phase of growth and have big plans for our new products.

We are getting serious about our teams and we are looking for someone to own and lead the development of our new Web applications and station management tools.

Tasks

  • Own the development lifecycle and architecture of the frontend team
  • Develop, implement and test new functionalities and architectures using Vue.js
  • Develop a responsive user interface while working directly with our Design team and Product
  • Prototype new concepts along with design and Product Management team
  • Be a perpetual innovator and status quo challenger
  • Develop and maintain test suites
  • Learn and share things you are passionate about
  • Be a key decision player and sparring partner for our CPO/CTO

Who we are looking for

  • Great tech skills, especially when it comes to topics such as JavaScript (Angular, Vue, React), Webpack, SASS, responsive web design
  • Good understanding of REST-based APIs, e.g. based on Ruby on Rails
  • Experience with agile processes (scrum, kanban)
  • Fluency in English is a must
  • Hands-on, you are always on the lookout for the best solution – also if it requires independently diving into new topics
  • You have at least 1 year experience as frontend team lead and you like to lead teams
  • You have built application architectures from scratch, being the key decision owner within your team.
  • Next to tech you have a few more hobbies ;)
  • You are passionate about fitness and sports

We offer

  • Very competitive salary.
  • An international, highly motivated team with an office located in central Berlin.
  • Very flexible working hours.
  • Relocation allowance for overseas candidates.
  • Excellent work / life balance.
  • Free gym membership.
  • Free coffee, tea, and fresh fruit.

Email jobs@pixformance.com to apply →

title.rendered: Back-End Developer (m/f) // FUNKE Digital TV Guide GmbH

content.rendered:
Are you cool, calm and collected? Do you have experience developing and maintaining services in Python and PHP/Symfony? If you are a proficient user of REST API´s, Git, Gerrit, MongoDB and Jenkins we want to hear from you. We belong to one of Germany’s largest publishing houses and are looking for a Back-End Developer to help us build and run our systems.

Your responsibilities

  • Create, extend and maintain Python and PHP/Symfony based back-ends and back-office applications for meta data management, monitoring, reporting and video workflow management
  • Efficiently use our Content Discovery API to implement innovative features in our B2B applications, support our customers to optimally use our API
  • Test support: Make sure the back-ends are testable, implement automated end-to-end functional and load/performance test procedures to increase overall product quality
  • Developer outreach: Represent our company and API at industry events like hackathons and meetups
  • Technology Selection: Member of the engineering team that evaluates and selects libraries and frameworks

Your skills

  • Degree or formal training in Computer Science
  • 5 years of back-end development experience, preferably in the TV and video space
  • Fluent in Python and fair knowledge of PHP (Symfony) in a Linux Environment
  • Having worked productively in other scripting languages is a plus
  • Multiple years of experience with REST APIs, MongoDB, relational databases
  • Diligent about version control (Git), clean code, unit testing and continuous integration (Jenkins)
  • Strong background and multiple years of experience in agile development processes
  • Strong communicator with fellow developers and customers
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented problem solver
  • Passion for media, TV & video is an advantage
  • Fluent English skills are required. The ability to write and present in German and additional languages is a plus

content.rendered:
allpago develops and provides the leading payment solutions for the Latin American region enabling global digital companies and other payment providers to process all local payment methods, which make up over 70% of the Latin American eCommerce volume. We serve BMW, Getty Images, McAfee, Salesforce, Symantec, Teamviewer and leading providers such as ACI, Paysafe, PayPal, Wirecard, Zuora in Latin America. Until today we managed to grow organically without any external investors, and now we need you to keep on building our promise of accepting payments in Latin America.

As support for our IT teams in Mexico City and Berlin we are looking for a talented and passionate QA & Test Engineer for our Berlin office. Within this role you will work in a cutting edge agile software development environment to ensure the quality of the architecture and development of our software applications. You are supposed to write automated tests at the services/integration and UI layers, using software automation tools. Integration into the organization and building a close collaboration to PO and Business is also part of your duties. With these obligations you will become a vital part in the enhancement, deployment and automation of our payments infrastructure. You will work within an international team and have the opportunity to learn from highly skilled engineers.

Your Role

• Leverage agile testing framework, design and code functional/integration test

• Create test cases and scenarios for various components of the application that ensures the software meets the intended requirements

• Work closely with product owners to understand product specifics and to create corresponding test plan, quality standards, and strategies for the project

• Execute test cases and scripts, log and track problems (bugs) and perform data validation

• Drive the constant improvement of our test automation and continuous integration practices

• Assist developers with debugging defects\Prod tickets by reproducing them in the Test Environment.

• Implement and maintain regression test framework

• Work closely with our DevOps and development team to integrate continuous delivery in the development cycle

Your Profile

• At least 2 years topic related experience with proven track record, Bachelor’s or Master’s degree is a plus. Alternatively, equivalent combination of education and work experience

• Programming fundamentals and familiarity with JavaScript and UI frameworks

• Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills

• Knowledge of testing methodologies and frameworks

• Software testing certifications, training or proven experience

• Experience working in an Agile (Kanban or Scrum) environment is a plus

• Experience working on Cloud Computing technologies

• Able to write reports/correspondence/procedure manuals, and present information

• Basic understanding of distributed infrastructure & platforms

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English is a must, Spanish and Portuguese is a plus

If you are willing to join the Berlin startup scene and to work in a fast moving, innovative and international environment, please send your cover letter, CV, and academic records to us. If you are eligible, passionate about building long-term business partnerships and deliver results, we will reach out to you!

title.rendered: Senior Linux Administrator / SysOps for FinTech // allpago GmbH

content.rendered:
allpago develops and provides the leading payment solutions for the Latin American region enabling global digital companies and other payment providers to process all local payment methods, which make up over 70% of the Latin American eCommerce volume. We serve BMW, Getty Images, McAfee, Salesforce, Symantec, Teamviewer and leading providers such as ACI, Paysafe, PayPal, Wirecard, Zuora in Latin America. Until today we managed to grow organically without any external investors, and now we need you to keep on building our promise of accepting payments in Latin America.

Our team is looking for a highly skilled Senior Linux Administrator/SysOps engineer that will manage the deployment and automation of our payments infrastructure. Before all, you want to understand the business needs and give critical input. You are a self-starter and pro-actively drive your projects putting the team ﬁrst and the ego last.

Your Role

  • should have 3+ years of experience in deploying and maintaining Linux servers. Familiarity with Agile methodologies and data security are required skills
  • Automate the deployment and conﬁguration of our services in a scalable and multi-regionalinfrastructure
  • Work closely with the development team to integrate continuous delivery in the development cycle
  • Apply best practices to an infrastructure and data storage level to ensure the best possible security setup

Your Profile

  • Excellent administration skills of Linuxsystems
  • Excellent understanding of data and infrastructuresecurity
  • Excellent in scripting and administration of AWS-services
  • Experience in performance optimization, debugging andproﬁling
  • Experience in continuous integration and delivery processes using Jenkins
  • Ability to work remotely in an internationalteam
  • Fluent spoken Englishskills
  • Experience in payments (PCI-DSS) and security industry is aplus
  • Experiences in any certification process is a plus

We offer you an international working environment with ﬂat hierarchies in the heart of Berlin and the opportunity to work across regions with your peers in Brazil and Mexico. Over 80% of our clients come from the Silicon Valley which ensures an innovative and challenging working environment. Please send your cover letter, CV and relevant job references to us. If you are eligible, passionate about building long-term business partnerships and deliver results, we will reach out to you!

title.rendered: Full Stack Developer (m/f) – Focus Frontend // Visual Meta

content.rendered:
At Visual Meta Business Labs, we are committed to build the next generation of e-commerce tools and technologies. We are part of Visual Meta, a successful and steadily growing web company, founded in 2009 and acquired by the Axel Springer Group in 2011.
Operating from a great office in central Berlin, we offer the professionalism of a big player and the company culture of a startup.

Your mission at Visual Meta? As Full Stack Developer in our Business Labs team you will have the responsibility of designing and building solutions for our new products and businesses as well as acting as a gatekeeper for new technologies and frameworks.

YOUR CHALLENGES AND TASKS

  • You define and develop the most appropriate architecture to build our new business ideas
  • You choose the most suitable technology stack for the task, in cooperation with your teammates
  • You scale and enhance the project in close cooperation with the business side
  • You are a gatekeeper for new technologies and frameworks
  • Your challenges are not caused by legacy code – they are created by growth and business demand
  • You collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features
  • You continuously discover, evaluate and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency

YOU OFFER

  • You possess an university degree in engineering, computer science or similar
  • You bring at least 2-3 Years of relevant work experience as a developer, ideally frontend and backend experiences
  • You have an understanding of agile product development
  • You possess a strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • You have fluent English skills
  • You possess experiences in writing and shipping code with a modern web application framework
  • You bring the following technology knowledge:
  • Web fundamentals like HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
  • Proven development experience with Java and a good understanding of Spring framework
  • ES6 / TypeScript, Framework (e.g. s Angular.js / React.js + Redu), Test framework (e.g. s Jasmine / Mocka + Sinon + C), Task runner (e.g. s Webpack / Gulp / Gru)
  • CSS: Sass and Experience of OOCSS / SMACSS / BEM

WHAT WE OFFER

  • We offer you a competitive salary package.
  • We innovate, build products that matter and support entrepreneurial spirit and initiative.
  • We love diversity – Our team contains over 50 nationalities
  • We see your development as our priority – Profit from a structured onboarding process, internal and external training possibilities and more.
  • We are responsible – with us you have the option to become socially involved (e.g. charity lunch)

IS THIS THE JOB YOU ARE LOOKING FOR?

Go ahead and submit your application in English including CV, salary expectations and your availability. As your responsible recruiter, Nikolina Dosen will be your point of contact.

content.rendered:
SAP HANA is SAP’s ground-breaking in-memory database platform. It provides a powerful foundation for existing SAP products as well as for new applications on device, in the cloud and on premise. Our developers work closely with other teams of developers in Europe, North America, and Asia, to implement flexible, reliable, and scalable solutions, using the latest innovations in hardware, operating systems, and virtualization technology.

View job + apply on the corporate career site here.

As a developer in the SAP HANA Lifecycle Management team in Berlin, Germany, you will be responsible for analysis, design, implementation, testing, continuous improvements, documentation, and maintenance of the SAP HANA Lifecycle Management suite of tools.

Required skills

  • Strong analytical skills, ability to structure complex problems, and to do conceptual work
  • Advanced Linux administration skills
  • Advanced programming skills in C/C++ and/or Perl
  • Experience with Docker, Windows operating system, Python, Git, Gerrit
  • Very good communication and presentation skills in both German and English
  • Strong team player
  • University degree in computer science or related areas with excellent grades
  • Graduates welcome!

View all SAP HANA jobs on the corporate career site here.

content.rendered:
SAP HANA is SAP’s ground-breaking in-memory database platform. It provides a powerful foundation for existing SAP products as well as for new applications on device, in the cloud and on premise. As a developer in this team, the focus of your daily work will be to engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of SAP HANA DIaaS services.

View job and apply on the corporate career site here.

Your responsibility will be to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software of DIaaS services. Automation of routine tasks, insuring the reliability of these services just as incident response and postmortems will be part of your daily work as well.

Required skills

  • Strong analytical skills, ability to structure complex problems, and to do conceptual work
  • Experience in cloud platforms, cloud infrastructure and cloud technologies
  • Advanced Linux administration skills
  • Experience with Docker, Git and Gerrit
  • Experience in one or more of the following: Java, Groovy, Python, Perl or Ruby
  • Very good communication and presentation skills in both German and English
  • Graduates welcome!
